summary: This document contains email correspondence regarding the J. Epstein Foundation Inc. and issues related to signing authority for a brokerage account. It includes communications between various individuals discussing the need for corporate authorization and the signing authority of Erika Kellerhals.

persons.name: Mayur Rathod
persons.context: Mayur Rathod is included in the email chain as a recipient of the forwarded message.

persons.name: Vijay-A Sawant
persons.context: Vijay-A Sawant is the sender of the email forwarding the correspondence regarding the Epstein Foundation.

persons.name: Alka Babu
persons.context: Alka Babu is included as a recipient in the forwarded email from Vijay-A Sawant.

persons.name: Bradley Gillin
persons.context: Bradley Gillin is the sender of the original email regarding the Epstein Foundation's brokerage account.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Richard Kahn discusses the signing authority related to the Epstein Foundation in his email.

persons.name: Erika Kellerhals
persons.context: Erika Kellerhals is mentioned as the secretary and treasurer of the Epstein Foundation but does not have signing authority on the account.

persons.name: Stewart Oldfield
persons.context: Stewart Oldfield is included in the email chain as a recipient of the correspondence.

connections.description: Vijay-A Sawant forwards an email from Bradley Gillin regarding the Epstein Foundation.
Richard Kahn responds to Bradley Gillin's inquiry about the signing authority for the Epstein Foundation.
Erika Kellerhals is mentioned as the secretary and treasurer under Richard Kahn's communication regarding signing authority.

locations: 575 Lexington Avenue, 4th Floor, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: The email discusses the J. Epstein Foundation Inc. and issues related to signing authority for a brokerage account.
Erika Kellerhals is identified as the secretary and treasurer of the Epstein Foundation but lacks signing authority.
Richard Kahn indicates the need for corporate authorization for the brokerage account.
The correspondence involves multiple individuals discussing internal matters related to the Epstein Foundation.
There are references to the need for a corporate resolution for the brokerage accounts.
